instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL is another way to say SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL, look at the definition provided for SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL as it applies to .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
Hi.

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, that only works with power cable connected.

Battery isen't recognized is macOS.

Already tried a known good battery, but same result.

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL>/SDA lines on battery conector seams to be ok: 0.550 in diode reading.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message: What is the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (without battery connected)?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.58V w/o battery.

With the LID conector disconected is the same result.

Shall I replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
Do you have correct voltage on SCL/SDA lines too?
Any history available?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
No history. Just stoped working, the client says.

SCL/SDA on battery conector are 3.47V (I think that they are correct)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
Hi,
Already disconected BIL, but same result.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message: Change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> first, but probably need to change SMC...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
Hi,
Replaced SMC and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, but same result. Not charging

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR>.
Do you get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery alone (no charger)?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
Hi,
I get 2.3V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with only the battery connected, but this battery probably is almost discharged.
<RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> seams to be ok and has 9.8 kohm

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
Check with known good battery; even one from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> can help for test.
Also test actual one into other machine (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> maybe).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no battery
threads.message:
It were the batteries (tried with 3 different ones, and all were bad). The last one was good, and now it is charging.
TKS!
